intro: Centaurea ducellieri, commonly known as the Alpina Centaury, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are blue to violet in color, with a distinctive central disk surrounded by ray florets. Centaurea ducellieri thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats.
